Contradict fact: The claim that the LGBT group is adding a "P" to their name to represent pedosexuals contradicts the fact that no genuine LGBT group has condoned pedophilia or announced such a change in their acronym.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that the LGBT community is accepting and promoting pedophilia, despite there being no scientific proof to support this connection.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fraudulent poster created as part of a misinformation campaign on 4chan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the addition of a "P" to the LGBT acronym represents pedosexuals, which is a problematic assumption as it is not based on any genuine evidence or statements from LGBT groups.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider any alternative explanations for the creation of the fraudulent poster, such as a deliberate attempt to spread misinformation and generate controversy.
